result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $500 sig bond; missed hrg 10-14-22
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

9:22 AM Defendant Merry Christina Starszak not in court.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for Merry Christina Starszak.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. 
RCAP has filed a violation report on 9-29-22.
Deft does not appear.
Defense is not sure why the deft is not here.
Defense would ask no action be taken on bond.
State indicates she counts 6 RCAP violations.
State is requesting the bond be forfeited.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 48 hrs.
from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.
**8-22-22 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW TESTING THROUGH THE DEFT'S AODA PROGRAM OUT IN WAUKESHA.**

9:05 AM Defendant Merry Christina Starszak in court.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for Merry Christina Starszak.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
RCAP has filed a violation report on 7-27-22.
Defense indicates the deft tested before this morning and tests came back negative.
State has some concerns as this is the 2nd violation report.
Defense is requesting a new status date.
Deft is still in treatment.
Defense would also ask that bond be modified to allow the deft to be tested through her AODA program.
State objects.
BTC: Modify bond to allow the deft to test through her AODA program in Waukesha, No action take on bond at this time, matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

8:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merry Christina Starszak in court.  Attorney McKenna Quinter for Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for Merry Christina Starszak. DAR Court Reporter Amanda Chentnik. 
Matter is set by the Court to review the deft's bond.
RCAP violation reports have been filed.
State has some concerns but is willing to give the deft one more opportunity.
Deft is working on scheduling an AODA assessment.
Defense would ask the deft be admonished and not taken into custody.
BTC: No action on bond, deft is to be tested weekly going forward, deft is to report today for testing, matter adjourned.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merry Christina Starszak appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Merry Christina Starszak. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
